intro: Wahlenbergia caledonica, commonly known as the Caledonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Saint Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh maritime climate. Its blue to violet flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and protected species.
